com.joliciel.talismane.sentenceAnnotators

Interface RegexAnnotator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Annotator<Sentence>, SentenceAnnotator
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRegexAnnotator, RegexAttributeAnnotator, RegexTokenAnnotator

    public interface RegexAnnotator
extends SentenceAnnotator
    A sentence annotator which identifies areas to annotate using a regular expression. The regular expression can also give context, with the actual sequence to annotate identified by a group in the regex.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Set of attributes to be assigned to tokens entirely contained in the sequence identified by this regex.
      int getGroupIndex()
      If provided, indicates the regex capture group index.
      java.util.regex.Pattern getPattern()
      The pattern used by this filter.
      java.lang.String getRegex()
      The regex to recognise.
      boolean isAutoWordBoundaries()
      If true, will automatically add a word boundary at the beginning and end of the regex, as long as the regex begins/ends with a letter (inside round or square brackets or not), or one of the character classes \d, \w, or \p{WordList|Lower|Upper|Alpha|Digit|ASCII}.
      boolean isCaseSensitive()
      If false, will replace any letter by a class containing the uppercase and lowercase versions of the letter.
      boolean isDiacriticSensitive()
      If false, will replace any adorned letter with a class containing both unadorned and adorned versions.

    • Method Detail

      • getRegex

        java.lang.String getRegex()
        The regex to recognise.

      • getPattern

        java.util.regex.Pattern getPattern()
        The pattern used by this filter.
        Returns:

      • getGroupIndex

        int getGroupIndex()
        If provided, indicates the regex capture group index. Useful for identifying sections by their context. Default is 0, meaning the entire regex matched.

      • getAttributes

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,TokenAttribute<?>> getAttributes()
        Set of attributes to be assigned to tokens entirely contained in the sequence identified by this regex.

      • addAttribute

        void addAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                  TokenAttribute<?> value)

      • isAutoWordBoundaries

        boolean isAutoWordBoundaries()
        If true, will automatically add a word boundary at the beginning and end of the regex, as long as the regex begins/ends with a letter (inside round or square brackets or not), or one of the character classes \d, \w, or \p{WordList|Lower|Upper|Alpha|Digit|ASCII}. Note that a + at the end of the regex is ignored, but a * or ? is not (as it doesn't guarantee that the class will be matched). Default is false.

      • isCaseSensitive

        boolean isCaseSensitive()
        If false, will replace any letter by a class containing the uppercase and lowercase versions of the letter. If the letter has a diacritic, both the unadorned and adorned uppercase versions will be included. Default is true.

      • isDiacriticSensitive

        boolean isDiacriticSensitive()
        If false, will replace any adorned letter with a class containing both unadorned and adorned versions. Default is true.
